snippet.textDisplay: Thank you so freaking much for uploading this! This gotta be one of my most favorite video game tunes EVER. I always cry when playing this level... The music is just so fucking beautiful... I really can't describe how much I love this song... ;_;

snippet.textDisplay: I loved every single track in this entire game.  David Wise is an amazing composer and, in my opinion, Tropical Freeze was better than Returns, which is saying something because Returns is, in my opinion, the best Wii game, even over the Mario Galaxy games.
snippet.textOriginal: I loved every single track in this entire game.  David Wise is an amazing composer and, in my opinion, Tropical Freeze was better than Returns, which is saying something because Returns is, in my opinion, the best Wii game, even over the Mario Galaxy games.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm in love with this game right now, The graphics, gameplay and music are outstanding (David Wise <3).
snippet.textOriginal: I'm in love with this game right now, The graphics, gameplay and music are outstanding (David Wise <3).

snippet.textDisplay: Seems to me like the soundtrack of the entire year. I've yet to hear a single song off this OST I dislike. Can't wait to experience it in-game once I get my Wii U at Mario Kart's launch.
snippet.textOriginal: Seems to me like the soundtrack of the entire year. I've yet to hear a single song off this OST I dislike. Can't wait to experience it in-game once I get my Wii U at Mario Kart's launch.

snippet.textDisplay: Wow, this is Wise? I was thinking how they need to bring Wise back because this song really isn't that great, looks like he is just getting worse with age.

snippet.textDisplay: Holy Crap! David Wise is back 100%!!!! Great, great song indeed. It has that typical DKC feeling to it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Amazing track. I'm glad David Wise has managed to translate his sound to the modern hardware just fine.
The last console I owned was a NES, but I'll probably buy a Wii U.
Looking forward to this game.

snippet.textDisplay: I hated DKCR, and I don't imagine I would like this game any more, but the soundtrack is quite nice.  Glad to see Wise doing this sort of work again.

snippet.textDisplay: When I saw the first trailer, it looked just like a DKCR clone, but seriously, I bought it a while ago, and it's almost as great as the old SNES ones! I was positively suprised, I'm sure you'll be too. : )

snippet.textDisplay: I can almost hear some of the old DKC songs mixed in with some new melodies. Welcome back, David Wise.
snippet.textOriginal: I can almost hear some of the old DKC songs mixed in with some new melodies. Welcome back, David Wise.

snippet.textDisplay: Welcome back, David Wise. DKCR was my Game of the Year in 2010 so I'm really looking forward to playing this once I get a Wii U. It's good to have Wise back with his great musical range. Be it sad, happy, atmospheric or rocking tracks, they're always full of quality. Hopefully this game's level design is as good as DKCR's.
snippet.textOriginal: Welcome back, David Wise. DKCR was my Game of the Year in 2010 so I'm really looking forward to playing this once I get a Wii U. It's good to have Wise back with his great musical range. Be it sad, happy, atmospheric or rocking tracks, they're always full of quality. Hopefully this game's level design is as good as DKCR's.
